63rd Annual Advanced Postgraduate Course
March 4 - 6, 2016, San Francisco, California

General Information

Schedule

The meeting will begin at 1:00 p.m. on Friday, March 4, 2016 and conclude at 12:15 p.m. on Sunday, March 6, 2016. The meeting will be held at the Hyatt Regency San Francisco Hotel in San Francisco.

Speaker Presentation Slides
In order to provide attendees with the most complete set of companion materials, registered attendees will be provided access to a website containing speaker presentation slides prior to the start of the meeting. Attendees should print or save to their electronic device the presentations that they are interested in prior to arriving to the meeting. The presentation slides will not be included in the Syllabus. At the meeting, attendees will be provided with a complimentary flash drive to download any slides that weren't available prior to the meeting. Please note that there will be no printers available onsite at the meeting.

Photography/Video
Photography, including camera-enabled cell phones, videotaping, and audio recording during the meeting is forbidden.

ShopDiabetes Store
Be sure to take time to visit the Association's ShopDiabetes Store during the meeting to see the array of books available.

Dress Code
We encourage participants to dress comfortably in business casual attire. Temperatures in meeting rooms will vary so we suggest you bring a sweater or light jacket to the sessions. Please note that ADA will provide only a self-serve unmanned coat check. We cannot accept liability for your coat or jacket.

 Saturday, March 5, 2016 - Support ADA's movement to stop diabetes by wearing red. Have you joined the millions? Visit www.stopdiabetes.com today!


Weather
Weather in San Francisco for early March averages between 49Â°-61Â°F (9Â°- 16Â°C) so it is advisable to bring a light jacket or coat.

Non-Smoking Policy
The 63rd Annual Advanced Postgraduate Course is a non-smoking meeting. Smoking is prohibited at all times in the meeting rooms, public areas, and restrooms. Your compliance is appreciated.
